doc.field: Narrative of an Exploratory Tour of the North East of the Colony of the Cape of Good Hope
A.S. Robertson and Saul Solomon and Company

[Source - Benathi Marufu for FHYA, 2020: A digital copy of Arbousset, Thomas, Narrative of An Exploratory Tour North-East of the Colony of the Cape of Good Hope by the Revs. T. Arbousset and F. Daumas, translated by Brown, John Croumbie. Cape Town: A. S. Robertson and Saul Solomon, 1846 [1842].] [Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A digitised copy of the book published by the French missionary Thomas Arbousset in 1846, being the first translation in English of the 1842 French edition. This edition did not include lithographies and it is unclear if it included the map; this copy does not include the map.]

Relation dun voyage dexploration au nord-est de la Colonie du Cape de Bonne-Esperance, entrepris dans le mois de mars, avril et mai 1836 par Mm
The Library of the University of California

[Source - Benathi Marufu for FHYA, 2020: A digital copy of Arbousset, Thomas, Relation dun voyage dexploration au nord-est de la Colonie du Cape de Bonne-Esperance, entrepris dans le mois de mars, avril et mai 1836 par Mm. T. Arbousset et F. Daumas. Paris: Arthus Bertrand, 1842.] [Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A digitised copy of the book published by the French missionary Thomas Arbousset in 1842, covering the travels he and Francois Daumas undertook in 1836 in the regions surrounding the Caledon Valley, in modern Lesotho and Free State Province. The book was first published in French. This edition contains lithographies and a map; this digital copy does not include the map and some pages are missing. No complete copy has been found online yet.]

Creative Commons License: CC BY-NC-ND https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/ Unless otherwise stated the copyright of all material on the FHYA resides with the contributing institution/custodian.
Les Bassoutos, ou vignt-trois annees de sejour et d'observations au sud de l'Afrique
Librairie de Ch. Meyrueis et C.ie

[Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A digitised copy of the book published by the French missionary Eugene Casalis when back from his evangelical fieldwork in modern Lesotho. The book was published during the wars between Lesotho and the Republic of the Orange Free State and advocated for the independence of the Basotho of Moshoeshoe. The book is roughly divided into a narrative of the arrival of the missionaries and a ethnographical description of the Basotho. The book contains lithographies and a map, included in this digital copy.]

Creative Commons License: CC BY-NC-ND https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/ Unless otherwise stated the copyright of all material on the FHYA resides with the contributing institution/custodian.
The Basutos; or Twenty-three Years in South Africa

[Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A digitised copy of the book published by the French missionary Eugene Casalis, being the translation of the book about his life in Lesotho published in French two years before. As for the French edition, note that the book was published during the wars between Lesotho and the Republic of the Orange Free State. It appears that the translation was done by Casalis himself. The book contains lithographies and a map, included in this digital copy.]

Notice biographique sur la vie, la conversion et la mort de Manoah, membre de l'eglise de Thaba-Bossiou, chez les Bechuanas-Bassoutos (Afrique Meridionale)

[Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A digitised copy of an obituary by the French missionary Eugene Casalis, being a booklet published as an extract from the French missionary periodical Journal des Missions evangeliques. The obituary commemorates Entouta Manoah, first Christian convert to die in Lesotho.]

Biographical Notice on the life, conversation and death of Manoah, member of the Church of the Thaba-Bossiu, among the Bechuanas-Bassoutos (South Africa), 1843. Translated by Morelli, Ettore

[Source - Benathi Marufu for FHYA, 2020: A digital copy of Casalis, Eugene's Biographical Notice on the life, conversation and death of Manoah, member of the Church of the Thaba-Bossiu, among the Bechuanas-Bassoutos (South Africa), 1843. Translated by Morelli, Ettore. Unpublished transcript sourced from the Bibliotheque Nationale de France, translation prepared for the Archive and Public Culture research initiative, 2020 [1843].] [Source - Ettore Morelli for FHYA, 2020: A working translation into English of the French text of the obituary by Eugene Casalis, commemorating Entouta Manoah]
